poem:
**Challenging Shadows**

In dim-lit rooms, where silence speaks,  
Echoes of justice stir and seek.  
A nurse, in shadowed hands, once lay—  
Now truth and doubt entwine the day.  
Infants' whispers haunt the air,  
While scholars gather, minds laid bare.  
What heavy hand does justice wield,  
When innocence and guilt conceal'd?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What is the new challenge to the evidence used to convict Lucy Letby? The evidence used to convict Lucy Letby will be challenged on Tuesday by a panel of experts convened by Dr Shoo Lee, a Canadian professor of paediatrics, whose own research formed part of the prosecution case. Letby, 35, is serving 15 whole-life prison terms after being convicted of murdering seven babies and attempting to kill another seven at the Countess of Chester". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
